text: あの、アスカは? / もう先に出てるわ
translation: Um, where's Asuka? / She already left ahead of us.
grammar: The sentence-final わ adds feminine emphasis, commonly used by female speakers in Japanese.

text: 徹底してあたしと顔を合わせないつもりね / どうしてですか?
translation: She's determined not to see my face at all, isn't she? / Why is that?
grammar: つもり expresses intention or plan. Here, ないつもり means 'intends not to'.

text: シンちゃんにはまだ女心はわからないか
translation: I guess Shin-chan still doesn't understand a woman's heart.
grammar: The sentence-final か softens the statement into a rhetorical question, expressing mild resignation.

text: あの / ところで
translation: Um... / By the way...
grammar: ところで is a discourse marker used to change topics in conversation.

text: どうぞ / 4号機が欠番って噂、本当ですか? / なんか事故があって / 爆発したって / ええ、本当よ
translation: Here you go. / Is the rumor that Unit-04 was scrapped true? / There was some kind of accident... / It exploded, they say. / Yes, it's true.
grammar: って is a casual quotative particle, equivalent to と言う (to say that).

text: 4号機はNERV第2主部と共に消滅したわ / S2機関の実験中にね / ここは大丈夫よ / 3体ともちゃんと動いてるじゃない
translation: Unit-04 was destroyed along with NERV's Second Branch. / During an S2 engine experiment. / This place is fine. / All three units are working properly, aren't they?
grammar: じゃない at the end of a sentence seeks confirmation, similar to 'isn't it?' or 'right?'

text: パイロットもスタッフも優秀だし / でもアメリカから3号機が来るって / 松城でするんでしょ、起動実験
translation: The pilots and staff are excellent too. / But they say Unit-03 is coming from America. / The activation test will be at Matsushiro, right?
grammar: でしょ is a casual form of でしょう, used to confirm or seek agreement.

text: うん、ちょっち4日ほど留守にするけど / 火事が面倒見てくれるから心配ないわよ / でも実験は…
translation: Yeah, I'll be away for about four days. / Kaji will take care of things, so don't worry. / But the experiment...

vocabulary.meaning: to take care of, to look after

grammar: ほど indicates approximation, meaning 'about' or 'approximately'.

text: リツコも立ち会うんだし、問題ないわよ / でもパイロット…
translation: Ritsuko will be there too, so there's no problem. / But the pilot...

vocabulary.meaning: to attend, to be present at

grammar: んだし combines explanatory の with し (listing reasons), emphasizing the reason given.

text: その…パイロットなんだけど…
translation: About that... the pilot...
grammar: なんだけど is used to bring up a topic hesitantly, often when delivering uncomfortable news.

text: はい! / おはようございます / 今日は、桂木さんさんにお願いにあがりました / 自分を…
translation: Yes! / Good morning! / Today, I've come to make a request to Ms. Katsuragi. / I want to be...
grammar: お願いにあがりました is a humble expression meaning 'I have come to make a request'.

text: 自分をエヴァンゲリオン3号機のパイロットにしてください / え?
translation: Please make me the pilot of Evangelion Unit-03! / Huh?
grammar: にしてください is a request form meaning 'please make (someone/something) into'.

text: じゃあまだシンジ君は知らないの? / なかなか言い出すきっかけがね / 怖いのよ / 時々何考えてるのかわからないし / しっかりしなさいよ
translation: So Shinji still doesn't know? / It's hard to find the right moment to tell him. / I'm scared. / Sometimes I don't know what he's thinking. / Get it together!

vocabulary.meaning: to start to say, to bring up

grammar: しなさい is an imperative form, softer than しろ but still commanding.

text: 自分で保護者役を買って出たんじゃない / そうなんだけどね
translation: You volunteered for the guardian role yourself, didn't you? / That's true, but...
grammar: 買って出る is an idiomatic expression meaning to voluntarily take on a role or responsibility.

text: で、いつ呼ぶのパイロット / そうね / 明日になるわね / 準備もいろいろあるし
translation: So, when will you call the pilot? / Let's see... / It'll be tomorrow. / There are various preparations to make.
grammar: し at the end lists reasons in a non-exhaustive way, implying there are other reasons too.

text: 彼が自分で言い出すかもしれないわ / それはないわね
translation: He might bring it up himself. / That won't happen.

vocabulary.meaning: to start saying, to bring up

grammar: かもしれない expresses possibility or uncertainty, meaning 'might' or 'maybe'.

text: 人に自慢するほど喜んでなかったもの / 入院中の妹を本部の医学部に定員させてくれっていうのが / 彼の出した例の条件だったのよ
translation: He wasn't happy enough to brag about it. / His condition was to have his hospitalized sister transferred to headquarters' medical department. / That was the condition he gave.
grammar: ほど here indicates degree - 'to the extent that' or 'enough to'.

text: ミサトさんも冷たいよ / やる気なら俺が一番なんだし
translation: Misato-san is cold too. / When it comes to motivation, I'm number one!
grammar: なら is a conditional meaning 'if it's about' or 'when it comes to'.

text: 予備でもいいから使ってくれりゃいいのに / なあトウジ
translation: I'd be fine as a backup, if only they'd use me. / Right, Toji?
grammar: くれりゃいいのに expresses a wish that won't be fulfilled - 'if only they would'.

text: あ、ああ / どうしたの? 先に出たのにずいぶん遅かったじゃない?
translation: Ah, yeah... / What happened? You left early but you're quite late, aren't you?
grammar: のに indicates contrast - 'even though' or 'despite the fact that'.

text: ねぇ、今日は夫婦喧嘩は無しかい。
translation: Hey, no married couple's fight today?
grammar: かい is a casual question ending, typically used by male speakers.

text: あんたたちの顔見たくなかっただけよ! このサンバカトリオが!
translation: I just didn't want to see your faces! You three idiots!
grammar: だけ means 'just' or 'only', here emphasizing the sole reason.

text: さて、飯、飯。 / あれ? 当時は? / いないんだよ。 / 飯も食わずに?あいつが?ありえない話だぞ
translation: Well then, food, food! / Huh? Where's Toji? / He's not here. / Without eating? Him? That's impossible!
grammar: ずに means 'without doing', connecting to the following clause.

text: うん変だよねこの頃
translation: Yeah, he's been strange lately.
grammar: よね combines よ (emphasis) and ね (seeking agreement), meaning 'isn't it?' while also asserting.

text: 鈴原くん
translation: Suzuhara.
grammar: くん is an honorific typically used for boys or younger males, showing familiarity.

text: あやなみかシンジやったらここにはおらんで
translation: If you're looking for Ayanami or Shinji, they're not here.

vocabulary.meaning: not here (Kansai dialect for いない)
if (Kansai dialect for だったら)

grammar: This uses Kansai dialect: おらん = いない (not here), やったら = だったら (if it's).

text: 知っとんのやろわしのこと / ソーリーも知っとるようやし
translation: You know about me, right? / Seems like the class rep knows too.
grammar: Kansai dialect: 知っとん (知っている), やろ (だろう), 知っとる (知っている), ようやし (ようだし)

text: それだけか。人の心配とは珍しいな。
translation: Is that all? It's unusual for you to worry about others.
grammar: とは marks the topic for contrast/emphasis, implying surprise at the behavior

text: そう?よくわから / ない。 / お前が心配しとんのはシンジや。
translation: Really? I don't really under- / -stand. / The one you're worried about is Shinji.
grammar: Kansai: 心配しとん (心配している), や (だ). The の nominalizes the clause.

text: そう。そうかもしれない。 / それや。
translation: I see. That might be true. / That's it.
grammar: かもしれない expresses possibility. それや is Kansai dialect for それだ (That's it).

text: ヒッカリー!お弁当食べよ!
translation: Hikari! Let's eat lunch!
grammar: 食べよ is the volitional form (let's eat), casual/friendly invitation

text: 遅れることを2時間、ようやくお出ましか。 / 私をここまで待たせた男は初めてでデートの時は待たずにさっさと帰ってたんでしょ?
translation: Two hours late, you finally show up. / You're the first man to make me wait this long. On dates you'd just leave without waiting, right?
grammar: 待たせた is causative past (made wait). んでしょ seeks confirmation.

text: でありましてこれが世に言うセカンドインパクトであります私はその頃根深川に住んでいたのですが南極大陸の妖怪に伴う水位の上昇により今では海の底になってしまいました。
translation: And so, this is what is known as Second Impact. At that time I was living in Nebukawa, but due to the rise in water levels accompanying the Antarctic meltdown, it is now at the bottom of the sea.
grammar: であります is formal/polite copula. に伴う means 'accompanying/due to'. てしまいました indicates completion with regret.

text: すまんなあ、天光星。わしはお前を殴らないいかん。殴っとかな、気が済まへんなよ。
translation: Sorry, Shinji. I have to hit you. If I don't hit you, I won't feel satisfied.

vocabulary.meaning: to be satisfied, to feel at ease

grammar: Kansai: ないいかん (なければいけない = must), 殴っとかな (殴っておかないと), 済まへん (済まない). Heavy dialect throughout.

text: ごめんね、アスカ。いつもならイカリ君と一緒に帰ってるのに、いいのよ。シンジとは義務でいるだけだし、今日は顔見たくない気分だったし。
translation: Sorry, Asuka. Usually you go home with Ikari-kun. / It's fine. I'm only with Shinji out of obligation, and today I didn't feel like seeing his face.
grammar: のに indicates contrast (even though usually...). だけだし explains reason casually.

text: 鈴原のことでしょ / わかる? / 見え見えよ
translation: It's about Suzuhara, right? / You can tell? / It's totally obvious.
grammar: のこと means 'about (someone)'. 見え見え is a reduplicated form emphasizing obviousness.

text: わかんないのはあの三馬鹿鳥よくらいね / でもイカリ君って内部そうだけど / あれが一番鈍感 / おまけにバカよ / 人との付き合い方知らないもの / そう
translation: The only ones who don't get it are those three idiots. / But Ikari-kun seems sensitive... / He's the most oblivious. / And stupid on top of that. / He doesn't know how to deal with people. / I see.
grammar: くらい means 'only/about'. って is casual topic marker. もの gives explanatory/emotional nuance.

text: 鈴原の好きな子って / 綾波さんかもしれない / 鈴原が / あの優等生
translation: The girl Suzuhara likes... / It might be Ayanami-san. / Suzuhara? / That honor student?
grammar: 好きな子って uses って as casual topic marker for 'the person someone likes'

text: をお昼仲良さそうだったし安心して光それはないわ あの女はシンジの一万倍も人との付き合い知らないものそう / そう
translation: They seemed friendly at lunch... / Don't worry, Hikari. That's not happening. / That girl doesn't know how to deal with people ten thousand times more than Shinji. / Really? / Really.
grammar: そう attached to adjective stem indicates appearance. も emphasizes the extreme degree.

text: 一つ聞いていい何あの熱血バカのどこがいいわけ
translation: Can I ask you something? What's so good about that hot-blooded idiot anyway?
grammar: 聞いていい asks permission. わけ at end demands explanation/reasoning.

text: 優しいところ
translation: His kind side.
grammar: ところ here means 'aspect' or 'quality' - his gentle/kind aspect

text: お疲れ様でした
translation: Good work today. / Thank you for your hard work.
grammar: Standard workplace/social greeting acknowledging someone's effort, used when parting or finishing work

text: あ?なんだ、またやりあってんのか?しょうがないな / カツラギがいないといつもこうなのか?
translation: Huh? What, are you fighting again? Can't be helped. / Is it always like this when Katsuragi isn't around?
grammar: てんのか is casual てるのか (ongoing action question). いないと means 'when not present'

text: 違うわよ!あたしだってカジさんと夜を過ごすんですもの / ニコニコ笑っていたいわよ
translation: That's not it! I'm spending the evening with Kaji-san too, you know. / I want to be all smiles.
grammar: だって means 'even I/also'. んですもの is feminine explanatory ending. ていたい expresses desire for continuous state.

text: でも今日はダメなの、できないの
translation: But today is no good, I just can't.
grammar: なの is feminine sentence ending seeking understanding/sympathy

text: わかった、もう寝よう / こういう時は早めに寝ちまうのが一番だ
translation: Alright, let's go to sleep. / At times like this, going to bed early is the best thing to do.

vocabulary.meaning: to sleep, to go to bed

grammar: 寝よう is volitional (let's sleep). 寝ちまう is casual てしまう (completely do). のが一番 means 'is the best'

text: もう寝ましたカジさん
translation: Are you asleep already, Kaji-san?
grammar: 寝ました in question form asks if someone has already gone to sleep

text: いやまだ
translation: No, not yet.
grammar: いや is casual 'no'. まだ with implied negative means 'not yet'

text: 僕の父さんってどんな人ですか / これはまた唐突だな / カツラギの話かと思ってたよ
translation: What kind of person is my father? / That's quite sudden. / I thought you'd talk about Katsuragi.
grammar: って is casual topic marker. かと思ってた means 'I thought (it would be)'

text: カジさんずっと一緒にいるみたいだし / 一緒にいるのは副司令さ
translation: You seem to always be with him, Kaji-san. / The one I'm with is the Vice Commander.
grammar: みたいだ expresses appearance/seeming. さ at end is masculine casual assertion

text: 君は自分の父親のことを聞いて回ってんのかね
translation: Are you going around asking people about your father?
grammar: 聞いて回る means to ask various people. てんのかね is casual ongoing action question with rhetorical nuance

text: ずっと一 / 緒にいなかったから / 知らないのか
translation: Because we weren't together for so long... / You don't know him?

vocabulary.meaning: for a long time, all along

grammar: から at end gives reason. のか is question particle showing realization/confirmation

text: でもこの頃わかったんです / 父さんのこといろいろと / 仕事のこととか母さんのこととか / だから / それは違うな / わかった気がするだけさ
translation: But lately I've come to understand / various things about my father / about his work and about my mother / So... / That's not quite right / You just feel like you understand

vocabulary.meaning: to be different, to be wrong
to feel like, to have a feeling that

grammar: The phrase 'わかった気がするだけさ' uses 気がする (feel like) + だけ (only/just) to express 'you only feel like you understand' - a common way to soften or qualify a statement.

text: 人は他人を完全には理解できない / 自分自身だって怪しいもんさ
translation: People can't completely understand others / Even understanding yourself is doubtful
grammar: The particle は in '完全には' creates emphasis/contrast - 'completely, at least' or 'as for completely'. The sentence-final もんさ (contraction of ものさ) adds a masculine, matter-of-fact tone.

text: 100%理解し合うのは不可能なんだよ / まあだからこそ人は自分を他人を知ろうと努力する
translation: Understanding each other 100% is impossible / But that's precisely why people make the effort to know themselves and others

vocabulary.meaning: precisely because, for that very reason
to make an effort, to strive

grammar: The verb form し合う indicates reciprocal action (doing something to/with each other). だからこそ emphasizes causation - 'precisely because of that'.

text: だから面白いんだな人生は / ミサトさんともですか
translation: That's what makes life interesting / With Misato-san too?
grammar: The sentence-ending んだな combines explanatory の (ん) with だ and な for reflection/realization. It's a masculine, contemplative ending meaning 'that's why... isn't it'.

text: 彼女というのは遥か彼方の女と書く / 女性は向こう岸の存在だよ / 我々にとってはね
translation: The word 'kanojo' (girlfriend) is written as 'woman far away' / Women are beings on the other shore / For us men, that is
grammar: This is a wordplay on kanji: 彼女 (kanojo/girlfriend) contains 彼 (kano/that, distant) + 女 (jo/woman). Kaji is philosophizing about the etymology to make a point about women being distant/unknowable.

text: 男と女の間には海よりも広くて深い川があるってことさ
translation: It means there's a river wider and deeper than the sea between men and women
grammar: The comparative よりも means 'more than'. The て-form 広くて connects two adjectives (wide AND deep). ってことさ is casual for ということだ (it means that).

text: 僕には大人の人は分かりません
translation: I don't understand adults
grammar: The pattern Xには...分かりません means 'X doesn't understand' or 'it's incomprehensible to X'. The には marks the person who lacks understanding.

text: これだと即実践も可能だわ / そうよかったわね / 気のない返事ね / この機体も納品されれば / あなたの直轄部隊に配属されるのよ / エヴァを4機も独占化
translation: With this, immediate deployment is possible / Good for you / That's an unenthusiastic response / Once this unit is delivered / it will be assigned to your direct command / Monopolizing four Evas...
grammar: The conditional されれば (if delivered) uses passive れる + conditional ば. 気のない返事 uses の to nominalize 気がない (unenthusiastic) to modify 返事 (response).

text: その気になれば世界を滅ぼせるわね / シンジ君に話はしたの? / 事件が終わったらね
translation: If you felt like it, you could destroy the world / Have you told Shinji? / After this is over

vocabulary.meaning: that inclination, the mood to do something

grammar: その気になれば means 'if one feels like it' - a useful expression. 滅ぼせる is the potential form of 滅ぼす. The たら conditional in 終わったら indicates 'when/after it ends'.

text: まだ来てないよねアスカ / うん、今日は来ないかもね
translation: Asuka hasn't come yet, has she? / Yeah, she might not come today

vocabulary.meaning: might, maybe (short for かもしれない)

grammar: 来てない is the casual negative て-form (来ていない). よね at the end seeks confirmation. かもね is a casual abbreviation of かもしれないね (might be).

text: 今日こそはと思ったのに
translation: I thought today for sure...
grammar: こそ is an emphatic particle meaning 'precisely' or 'for sure'. のに at the end expresses disappointment or unfulfilled expectation - 'even though I thought...' (trailing off).

text: 食べる?
translation: Want to eat?
grammar: A simple question formed by rising intonation on the dictionary form. Very casual way to offer food or suggest eating together.

text: 3号機ってもう日本に到着してんだろ?
translation: Unit 03 has already arrived in Japan, right?
grammar: The って is a casual topic marker (like は). してんだろ is a contraction of しているんだろう, combining progressive aspect with the explanatory んだ and presumptive だろう.

text: うん、角ついたみたいだけど / いいな、誰が乗るのかな
translation: Yeah, seems like it arrived / Nice, I wonder who'll pilot it
grammar: みたい expresses appearance or hearsay ('seems like'). のかな is a wondering/rhetorical question form - 'I wonder who...'.

text: 当時 / のやつかな、 / 今日休んでるしな / まさか
translation: Toji / Maybe it's him / He's absent today after all / No way
grammar: しな at the end adds a reason/explanation with a casual, masculine tone (since he's absent...). まさか expresses disbelief or 'surely not'.

text: エンドリングラル固定完了 / 第1次接続開始 / パルス送信 / グラフ正常位置 / リスト1350クリア / 初期コンパクト問題なし
translation: Entry plug secured / Beginning primary connection / Pulse transmission / Graph in normal position / List 1350 clear / Initial contact - no problems
grammar: Technical/military command language uses noun + 完了 (completed) and noun + 開始 (begin). These are clipped, efficient report-style phrases typical of control room dialogue.

text: 了解 作業をフェイズ2へ行こう / オールナーブリング問題なし / リスト2550クリア / ハーモニクスすべて正常位置 / 絶対の改善で突破します
translation: Roger, proceeding to Phase 2 / All nerve links - no problems / List 2550 clear / All harmonics in normal position / Breaking through at absolute borderline
grammar: 了解 is the standard military/professional acknowledgment. へ行こう uses volitional form to suggest proceeding. This is technical Eva operation terminology.

text: 実験中止 回路切断
translation: Abort experiment! Cut the circuits!
grammar: Emergency commands are given as bare nouns without verbs - 中止! (abort!) 切断! (cut!). This telegraphic style conveys urgency.

text: ダメです!体内に高エネルギー反応! / まさか…
translation: No good! High energy reaction inside the body! / It can't be...
grammar: ダメです is a polite but urgent 'it's no good/won't work'. まさか trailing off expresses shocked disbelief at an unthinkable possibility.

text: うっつと…
translation: (Sound of shock/impact)
grammar: This is an interjection/onomatopoeia expressing sudden shock, pain, or being struck. Common in dramatic moments.

text: 「まとめ
translation: (Title card or transition - possibly incomplete transcription)
grammar: This appears to be a title card or the beginning of a summary section. The bracket suggests it may be on-screen text.

text: 未確認移動物体を発見! / パターン / オレンジ! / 基礎とは確認できません!
translation: Unidentified moving object detected! / Pattern... / Orange! / Cannot confirm as Angel!
grammar: を発見 reports discovery using を for the direct object. The pattern color system (Blue=Angel, Orange=unknown) is Eva-specific terminology.

text: 第一種戦闘配置 / 総員第一種戦闘配置! / 次体育船用意! / エヴァ天気発進! / 連撃地点緊急配置! / 空輸開始は二丸を予定!
translation: Battle stations, Level One / All hands, Level One battle stations! / Prepare intercept system! / Eva units, launch! / Emergency deployment to intercept point! / Air transport scheduled for 1200 hours!
grammar: Military command style with 第一種 (Type/Level One) classification. Commands are given as noun phrases without explicit verbs for efficiency.

text: 松城で事故!? / そんな…じゃ、美里さん達は… / まだ連絡取れない / そんなどうしよう / 何ぐじぐじ言ってんのよ
translation: An accident at Matsushiro!? / No way... then Misato and the others... / We still can't reach them / What should we do... / Stop whining!
grammar: 達 (たち) is a pluralizing suffix for people. ぐじぐじ言う is an onomatopoeic expression meaning to whine or mope indecisively.

text: 今私らが心配したって何もならないでしょ / でも使徒相手に僕らだけで
translation: Worrying now won't do any good, will it? / But against an Angel, just us alone...
grammar: したって is casual for しても (even if we do). 何もならない means 'nothing comes of it/pointless'. 相手に means 'against' or 'facing' an opponent.

text: 今は怒り司令が直接指揮を取ってるわ / 父さんは
translation: Commander Ikari is directly in command now / Father...
grammar: 指揮を取る is a set phrase meaning 'to take command/be in charge'. The trailing 父さんは shows Shinji's emotional reaction, switching from the formal title to the personal 'Father'.

text: 延山で映像を捉えました / 下モニターに回します
translation: We've captured footage at Mount Nobu. Routing it to the lower monitor.
grammar: The て-form + ます (捉えました) indicates completed action in polite speech. 下モニターに回します uses に to mark the destination.

text: やはりこれか / 活動停止信号を発信 / エントリープラグを強制射出
translation: So it's this after all. Send the activity halt signal. Forcibly eject the entry plug.

vocabulary.reading: きょうせいしゃしゅつ

grammar: やはり...か expresses confirmation of a suspicion. The commands use noun forms (発信, 射出) as imperative orders in military/technical contexts.

text: ダメです / 停止信号およびプラグ排出コードを認識しません / パイロットは / 呼吸心拍の反応はありますが / おそらく
translation: No good! It's not recognizing the halt signal or plug ejection code. The pilot... there are breathing and heartbeat responses, but probably...
grammar: および is a formal conjunction meaning 'and/as well as'. The trailing おそらく (probably) with no completion creates dramatic tension.

text: エヴァンゲリオン3号機は現時刻をもって破棄 / 目標を第13使徒と識別する / しかし
translation: As of this moment, Evangelion Unit-03 is abandoned. The target is identified as the 13th Angel. However...
grammar: をもって is a formal expression meaning 'as of' or 'by means of'. 目標を...と識別する uses と to mark what something is identified as.

text: 予定通り延山で戦線を展開 / 目標を撃破しろ
translation: Deploy the battle line at Mount Nobu as planned. Destroy the target.
grammar: しろ is the imperative form of する, used for direct commands. 通り (どおり) attached to nouns means 'as per' or 'according to'.

text: 目標接近 / 前期地上戦用意 / まさか / 使 / 徒 / これが使徒ですか / そうだ目標だ
translation: Target approaching. Prepare for ground combat. No way... An Angel? This is an Angel? That's right, it's the target.
grammar: まさか expresses disbelief. The fragmented 使/徒 shows shocked, halting speech. ですか rising intonation shows incredulous questioning.

text: 目標ってこれはエヴァじゃないか
translation: The target... isn't this an Eva!?
grammar: って is a casual topic marker. じゃないか at the end expresses surprised realization or seeking confirmation - 'isn't it?' with rhetorical force.

text: そんな使徒に乗っ取られるなんて / やっぱり人が子供が乗ってるのかな / 同い年の / あんたまだ知らないの / 3号機にはね!
translation: To be taken over by an Angel like that... So there really is a person, a child piloting it? The same age as us... You still don't know? Unit-03 has...!
grammar: なんて expresses surprise or disbelief about a situation. のかな shows uncertain wondering. まだ知らないの with rising intonation shows exasperation.

text: アスカ!
translation: Asuka!
grammar: A simple exclamatory call - names shouted in alarm typically drop any honorifics in urgent situations.

text: アスカ!
translation: Asuka!
grammar: Repeated urgent call showing escalating concern. The repetition emphasizes the desperate situation.

text: エヴァ2号機、完全に沈黙! / パイロットは脱出。回収班、向かいます。 / 目標、移動。0号機へ。
translation: Eva Unit-02, completely silent! Pilot has ejected. Recovery team, heading out. Target moving toward Unit-00.
grammar: Military radio communication style uses clipped sentences. Noun phrases without verbs (目標、移動) convey information efficiently.

text: レイ、近接戦闘は避け、目標を足止めしろ。 / 今、4号機を回す。 / 了解。
translation: Rei, avoid close combat and hold the target. I'm sending Unit-04 now. Roger.
grammar: 避け is the conjunctive form connecting to the next command. しろ is the imperative of する. 回す here means to dispatch/send.

text: ゼロ号機、サワンに首都侵入! / 神経説が侵されていきます / サワン部切断 / 急げ
translation: Unit-00, contamination entering the left arm! The neural pathways are being invaded. Cut off the left arm section. Hurry!
grammar: ていきます (te-form + いく) shows progressive action moving away or continuing. 急げ is the imperative of 急ぐ (to hurry).

text: しかし、神経接続を解除しないと / 切断だ / はい
translation: But if we don't release the neural connection... Cut it off! Yes sir.
grammar: しないと is a conditional meaning 'if not done'. The incomplete sentence shows being cut off. 切断だ is a terse command using noun + だ.

text: ゼロ号機中波 パイロットは負傷 / そんな
translation: Unit-00 disabled. Pilot injured. No way...
grammar: Military report style with minimal particles. そんな as an exclamation expresses shocked disbelief at the situation.

text: 目標は接近中だ あと二丸で接触する お前が倒せ
translation: The target is approaching. Contact in 20 seconds. You take it down.

vocabulary.meaning: approaching, in the process of approaching

grammar: 中 attached to verbs indicates ongoing action. 倒せ is the imperative form of 倒す. あと...で means 'in (time remaining)'.

text: 目標って言ったって
translation: Even if you call it a target...
grammar: って言ったって is a colloquial expression meaning 'even if you say/call it'. It expresses objection or reluctance to accept something.

text: 人が乗ってるんじゃないの
translation: There's a person inside, isn't there?
grammar: んじゃないの is a colloquial way of seeking confirmation while expressing one's own belief. The ん is explanatory, じゃない seeks agreement.

text: 同い年の子供が
translation: A child the same age as me...
grammar: The sentence trails off with が, showing Shinji's emotional struggle to complete the thought about having to fight someone his own age.

text: くっ!
translation: Ngh!
grammar: An onomatopoeic expression of pain, strain, or frustration. Common in action scenes when characters are struggling physically.

text: 生命維持に支障発生! / パイロットが危険です! / いかん!シンクロ率を60%に勝ってた! / 待て!しかし、イカリ、このままではパエロットが死
translation: Life support malfunction! The pilot is in danger! No good! The sync rate dropped to 60%! Wait! But Ikari, at this rate the pilot will die...
grammar: に支障発生 is technical jargon for malfunction occurrence. このままでは means 'at this rate' or 'if things continue'. The cut-off 死 shows urgency.

text: 人だ!我々の敵だ! / でも… / でもできないよ! / 助けなきゃ…人殺しなんてできないよ! / お前が死ぬぞ!
translation: It's the enemy! Our enemy! But... But I can't do it! I have to save them... I can't commit murder! You'll die!
grammar: なきゃ is casual contraction of なければ (must). なんて after a noun expresses 'something like' with dismissive/emotional nuance. ぞ is a strong masculine assertion.

text: いいよ!人殺すよりはいい!
translation: Fine! That's better than killing someone!
grammar: よりは(いい) is a comparative structure meaning 'better than'. The first いいよ is accepting/dismissive ('fine then'), the second いい is 'better'.

text: 構わん!パイロットと初号機のシンクロを全面カットだ! / カットですか?
translation: Never mind him! Cut the synchronization between the pilot and Unit-01 completely! Cut it?
grammar: 構わん is a masculine/gruff negative of 構う. 全面カットだ uses noun + だ as a command. ですか shows surprise and seeking confirmation.

text: そうだ!回路をダミープラグに切り替えろ! / しかし、ダミーシステムにはまだ問題も多く、赤城博士の指示もなく… / 今のパイロットよりは役に立つ!やれ! / はい
translation: That's right! Switch the circuit to the dummy plug! But the dummy system still has many problems, and without Dr. Akagi's instructions... It's more useful than the current pilot! Do it! Yes sir.
grammar: 切り替えろ is the imperative of 切り替える. も多く uses も for 'also/even' with problems. よりは役に立つ is comparative 'more useful than'.

text: 何だ?
translation: What?
grammar: 何だ is a blunt/masculine way of asking 'what is it?' The だ adds assertion. Shows Shinji's confusion at suddenly losing control.

text: 何をしたんだ、捜査! / 信号、受信を確認! / 感染システム切り替え完了 / 全神経、ナビシステムへ直結完了
translation: What did you do?! Signal reception confirmed! Infection system switch complete. All neural connections directly linked to the navigation system.
grammar: 完了 (kanryō) is used at the end of statements to indicate 'complete' - common in technical/military communications.

text: 感情阻止の32.8%が不鮮明、モニターできません / 構わん / システム開放 砲撃開始
translation: 32.8% of emotional blocking is unclear, we can't monitor it. It doesn't matter. System release. Commence attack.
grammar: 構わん (kamawan) is a rough/masculine contraction of 構わない meaning 'I don't care' or 'it doesn't matter'.

text: これがダミープラグの力なの? / システム成長 / さらにゲインが上がります
translation: Is this the power of the dummy plug? System growth. The gain is increasing further.
grammar: なの at the end is a feminine question marker, softer than のか. Common in female speech.

text: 泊まれ 泊まれ泊まれ 泊まれ泊まれ
translation: Stop! Stop, stop! Stop, stop!
grammar: 止まれ is the imperative form of 止まる (to stop). The imperative is formed by changing the final -u to -e for godan verbs.

text: やめろ!
translation: Stop it!
grammar: やめろ is the rough imperative of やめる (to stop/quit). For ichidan verbs, drop -る and add -ろ.

text: やめろ!
translation: Stop it!

vocabulary.meaning: to stop, to quit, to give up

grammar: Repetition of やめろ shows desperation and urgency in the speaker's plea.

text: エ・エバー3号機 / あ、いえ、目標は完全に沈黙しました
translation: E-Eva Unit 03... Ah, no, the target has gone completely silent.
grammar: しました is the polite past form of する. The speaker corrects themselves from saying 'Eva' to 'target' - showing the emotional weight of the situation.

text: これにしよった / こだまお姉ちゃんとのぞみと私 / 4人分か
translation: I'll go with this one. Kodama, Nozomi, and me. So for four people, huh.
grammar: にする means 'to decide on' something. ～人分 is a counter for portions/servings per person.

text: 明日は食べてくれるかな / こっちにもいたぞ / 生存者だ / 行きは / 非常に空洞させてくれ
translation: I wonder if he'll eat tomorrow... There's someone here too! A survivor! Quick, make emergency space!
grammar: ～てくれるかな expresses wondering/hoping someone will do something for you. かな adds uncertainty.

text: 生きてる
translation: He's alive.
grammar: 生きてる is a contraction of 生きている - the -te iru form indicating a continuing state.

text: おかしい / よかったな / 桂木
translation: Strange... That's good. Katsuragi.
grammar: よかったな uses な as a masculine sentence-ending particle expressing emotion or seeking agreement.

text: いつかは
translation: Someday...
grammar: いつかは emphasizes 'someday' with は adding contrast or emphasis, suggesting determination about the future.

text: 心配ない / 君よりは軽傷だ
translation: Don't worry. Her injuries are lighter than yours.
grammar: より is a comparative particle meaning 'than'. 君よりは = 'compared to you' / 'than you'.

text: そう / エヴァ3号機は / 使徒として処理されたそうだ 正気に
translation: I see. Eva Unit 03 was reportedly disposed of as an Angel. Officially.
grammar: ～そうだ (hearsay) indicates reported information - 'I heard that...' or 'reportedly'.

text: 私 私 シンジ君に何も話してない
translation: I... I haven't told Shinji anything.
grammar: 何も + negative verb = 'nothing at all'. 話してない is casual contraction of 話していない.

text: シンジ君 / ミサトさん / 無事だったんですね
translation: Shinji! Misato-san! So you're safe.
grammar: ～んですね expresses realization or confirmation of something. The ん (short for の) adds explanation/emphasis.

text: 私はね、ごめんなさい。
translation: I... I'm sorry.
grammar: ね after 私は softens the statement and creates an emotional pause before the apology.

text: 私はあなたに大事なことを伝えなきゃいけなかったのに、こんなことに。
translation: I had to tell you something important, but it came to this.

vocabulary.meaning: to convey, to tell, to communicate

grammar: ～なきゃいけなかった is casual form of ～なければいけなかった meaning 'had to do'. のに at the end expresses regret - 'even though I should have'.

text: リストさん、僕は、僕は人を、父さんがやめてってたのなのに。
translation: Misato-san, I... I [hurt] a person, even though Father kept telling me to stop.
grammar: やめてって is casual contraction of やめてくれと言って - 'told me to stop'. のに expresses 'even though'.

text: シンジック、ごめんね、ごめんね。 / エントリープラグ回収班より連絡。パイロットの生存を確認。 / 生きてた。 / あの、3号機のパイロットは
translation: Shinji, I'm sorry, I'm sorry. Message from the entry plug recovery team. Pilot survival confirmed. He's alive. Um, the Unit 03 pilot is...
grammar: ～より is a formal way to say 'from' in official communications. 生きてた is casual past of 生きている.

text: NCLの変質サンプルは最優先で / オースチルドレンは
translation: The LCL altered sample is top priority. The Fourth Children is...
grammar: 最 (sai) prefix means 'most' or 'highest'. 最優先で = 'with top priority'.

text: 当時 / シンジ君 / シンジ君 / シンジ君 / シンジ君 / シンジ君
translation: Touji... Shinji! Shinji! Shinji! Shinji! Shinji!
grammar: 君 (kun) is a suffix typically used for boys/young men, showing familiarity. Repetition shows desperate calling.

text: シンジはついに自らの意思でエヴァーを降りる / だが彼に関係なく信仰する最強の人が次の惨劇を生むのだった
translation: Shinji finally decides to leave Eva by his own will. But regardless of him, the strongest one advancing will give birth to the next tragedy.
grammar: のだった is a narrative past tense used in storytelling, adding dramatic emphasis to the outcome.

text: 次回男の戦い
translation: Next time: A Man's Battle
grammar: 次回 is commonly used in anime/TV to introduce the next episode title.

text: Редактор субтитров А.Семкин Корректор А.Егорова
translation: (Russian credits: Subtitle editor A. Semkin, Proofreader A. Egorova)
grammar: This is Russian text (credits), not Japanese. It appears to be from a fan-subbed version.
